div1.p: Derby requests information on Jesse Lazear for the National Cyclopedia of American Biography.

div1.head: Letter from George Derby to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 26, 1915
div1.opener:
BOSTON
CHICAGO
PHILADELPHIA
SAN FRANCISCO
ST. LOUIS
JAMES T. WHITE
PRESIDENT
G. D. WHITE
TREASURER
F. B. KAIN
SECRETARY
JAMES T. WHITE & CO.
PUBLISHERS
70 FIFTH AVENUE, NEW YORK
October 26, 1915.
ESTABLISHED 1873
INCORPORATED 1902
TELEPHONES:
CHELSEA {8135
{8136
CABLE ADDRESS:
“JOIST, NEW YORK”
Mrs. Charlotte C. Sweitzer,
Walbrook,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Madam:-
div1.p:
I am preparing a biographical sketch of your son, the late Dr. Lazear,
for The National Cyclopedia of American Biography, in connection with biogra-
phies of Dr. Reed and other members of the profession. I have obtained con-
siderable data regarding his professional work, but I also want his family
record and have been referred to you for that. Will you kindly send me the
data indicated on the enclosed blank or as much of it as you are able, for
which I shall be greatly obliged.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, George Derby
Managing Editor.
